meanings.sent1: The government subsidized the local library to help it stay open.
meanings.sent2: Farmers often receive subsidized loans to help them purchase equipment.
meanings.sent3: The zoo was so grateful for the subsidized donations that they named a lion after the donor.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for education was subsidized by the generous scholarship she received.
meanings.sent5: The subsidized funding breathed new life into the struggling theater, allowing it to thrive once again.

meanings.definition: Obtain financial assistance from the government.
meanings.sent1: Many students rely on subsidized loans to afford their college education.
meanings.sent2: Low-income families can apply for subsidized housing to help with their rent.
meanings.sent3: The clever entrepreneur found a way to get subsidized support for his new business idea.
meanings.sent4: She felt relieved when she was able to be subsidized for her medical expenses during tough times.
meanings.sent5: The artist was overjoyed to be subsidized by a grant that allowed her to focus on her craft full-time.
